courses.subject: FAME
courses.title: Project Work and Report
courses.description: Option A: Each course participant is required to complete an individual project in the field of primary health care, under the direction of a supervisor. The study should be linked to the protocol developed during MFM8006. Course participants will be required to make regular presentations on the progress of the projects throughout the module. Option B: Fieldwork and applied research a. Attachment to FM clinic to develop advanced skills in family medicine: Each candidate would have 60 contact hours (4.5 credit units) with a tutor. Activities include case discussion, topic discussion, direct observation during consultation, and personal growth and development. b. Written assignment (4.5 credit units, 60 hours): Each candidate would be required to write up a clinical review on special client group, an observation study, or an audit report based on fieldwork, and the standard of which should be of publishable quality.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For student in Master of Family Medicine
courses.learning_outcomes:
Student should be able to:

1. develop skills and techniques in protocol writing.

2. develop relevant research skills in the development and design of a piece of research and in the analysis and conduct of that research.

3. learn about the process of identifying a research topic, how to review the literature critically, develop hypotheses and design the research protocol for testing those hypotheses.

4. learn about the process of collecting and analyzing the data, and presenting the findings in an appropriate manner for academic consumption.

5. develop a protocol for their master project and thesis.
